thread.title: Oregon shooter's father: 'How did he compile such an arsenal?'
thread.title_full: Oregon shooter's father: 'How did he compile such an arsenal?' | OregonLive.com

author: Elliot Njus | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Oregon shooter's father: 'How did he compile such an arsenal?'
text:
The father of Umpqua Community College gunman Christopher Sean Harper-Mercer said Saturday he had a harmonious relationship with his son, but didn't know he had acquired 14 guns.
Speaking to CNN on Saturday from his Torrance, California, home, Ian Mercer said he last saw his son before he left California for Oregon. He moved with his mother to Roseburg in 2013.
Ian Mercer said he knew little about his son's mental state leading up to the shooting, adding, "Obviously someone who goes and kills nine people has to have had some kind of issue."
Mercer was incredulous that his son had been able to buy the six weapons he used in the shooting and eight others recovered from his residence.
"How is it so easy to get all these guns?" Mercer said. "I've never held a gun in my life. You have to ask the question, how did he compile such an arsenal?"
The Oregon State Police had earlier released a statement the agency said was provided by a spokesman for Harper-Mercer's family: "We are shocked and deeply saddened by the horrific events that unfolded on Thursday, October 1. Our thoughts, our hearts and our prayers go out to all of the families of those who died and were injured."
-- Elliot Njus
